query: Import a standard library for input/output operations.
Define the main entry point of the program.
Define an integer variable and assign it an initial value.
Define integer variables without immediate initialization.
Display formatted output to the standard output stream.
Iterate a block of code a specified number of times.
Assign the sum of two variables to another variable.
Update a variable's value with the value of another variable.
Exit the main function and return an integer value (success).
